text: Scirpophaga linguatella is a moth in the family Crambidae. It was described by Fu-Qiang Chen, Shi-Mei Song and Chun-Sheng Wu in 2006. It is found in Yunnan, China. Both the forewings and hindwings are uniform white. ==References== Category:Moths described in 2006 Category:Schoenobiinae Category:Moths of China
title: Scirpophaga linguatella
